heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No storms are expected.  The last storm was observed on 28 September 2025 and continued for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (180°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 52.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The largest wind gust ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 1.6°C).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 42.2°C), feels like temperature (up 44.0°C), and outside temperature (up 44.8°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 337.7m lower than yesterday, 93.3m lower than the past week, 36.8m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1184m to a maximum of 3910m, averaging 1776.4m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1869.7m and 1739.6m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, humidity should not be a concern and very little to no wind will be present. Possible light showers, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and periods of sunshine are expected. The weather will likely remain the same.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
